status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

worklogs.comment:
github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13480:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13480#issuecomment-1171237183

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Python implementation of pyarrow missing basic functionality like delete, rename & stat
fields.summary: [Python] LocalFileSystem is missing some basic function

comments.body:
Did you take a look at the API? What is missing exactly there for you?

[https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.fs.LocalFileSystem.html#pyarrow.fs.LocalFileSystem]

Oops, you are using the deprecated legacy filesystem interface (you should have seen a warning when doing that).

You should use the modern filesystem API from {{{}pyarrow.fs{}}}, see [https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/filesystems.html]
Ahh. I think it should be removed now if it's deprecated long time back. As most of the stackoverflow & others has answers related to this
Yes, that is tracked in ARROW-15761. cc [~jorisvandenbossche]
Sorry for the inconvenience. I'm closing this as won't do, as it only affects the deprecated filesystem API.

[~apitrou] Latest implementation is missing exists, list, is_dir, is_file kind of implementations which is present in the old implementation. As moving away from deprecated one to new one need these implementation. Should I create ticket for the same?
[~pasalkarsachin1]  That information get be obtained using {{{}get_file_info{}}}.

[~apitrou] Probably last question we are using the disk_usage functionality of deprecated API.

However I see the size is only available to [file type|https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.fs.FileInfo.html#pyarrow.fs.FileInfo.size] but will not be to directory. However we are trying to find out empty directories in our code. How should I proceed. Also you guys have slack channel?
I don't want to keep running FileSelector on it each time
We have a Zulip chat that you can freely sign up to: https://ursalabs.zulipchat.com/

Since it seems that you are using HDFS, I wanted to note that the fsspec package has a wrapper around our pyarrow.fs.HadoopFileSystem that adds some additional methods (https://filesystem-spec.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#fsspec.implementations.arrow.HadoopFileSystem)
